extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.groovyx.ExecuteGroovyScript
extension.description: Experimental Extended Groovy script processor. The script is responsible for handling the incoming flow file (transfer to SUCCESS or remove, e.g.) as well as any flow files created by the script. If the handling is incomplete or incorrect, the session will be rolled back.

property.name: groovyx-script-file
property.description: Path to script file to execute. Only one of Script File or Script Body may be used

property.name: groovyx-script-body
property.description: Body of script to execute. Only one of Script File or Script Body may be used

property.name: groovyx-failure-strategy
property.description: What to do with unhandled exceptions. If you want to manage exception by code then keep the default value `rollback`. If `transfer to failure` selected and unhandled exception occurred then all flowFiles received from incoming queues in this session will be transferred to `failure` relationship with additional attributes set: ERROR_MESSAGE and ERROR_STACKTRACE. If `rollback` selected and unhandled exception occurred then all flowFiles received from incoming queues will be penalized and returned. If the processor has no incoming connections then this parameter has no effect.

property.name: groovyx-additional-classpath
property.description: Classpath list separated by semicolon or comma. You can use masks like `*`, `*.jar` in file name.

dynamicProperty.name: A script engine property to update
dynamicProperty.value: The value to set it to
dynamicProperty.description: Updates a script engine property specified by the Dynamic Property's key with the value specified by the Dynamic Property's value. Use `CTL.` to access any controller services, `SQL.` to access any DBCPServices, `RecordReader.` to access RecordReaderFactory instances, or `RecordWriter.` to access any RecordSetWriterFactory instances.

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles that failed to be processed

restriction.explanation: Provides operator the ability to execute arbitrary code assuming all permissions that NiFi has.
